what-it-does: Checks for pytest.warns calls without an expected warning.
why-is-this-bad:
pytest.warns expects to receive an expected warning as its first
argument. If omitted, the pytest.warns call will fail at runtime.
example:
import pytest


def test_foo():
    with pytest.warns():
        do_something()



Use instead:


import pytest


def test_foo():
    with pytest.warns(SomeWarning):
        do_something()

example-split.example-before:
import pytest


def test_foo():
    with pytest.warns():
        do_something()
